intro: Pseudognaphalium albescens, commonly known as white daisy or white fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has a mat-forming growth habit and produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as meadows and sandy soils, and is often found in disturbed areas. Pseudognaphalium albescens is an important plant for pollinators and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
